intro: Eleocharis albibracteata var. nubigena, commonly known as the cloud-draped spikerush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to wetland environments. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, white or pale-colored bracts that give it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, thriving in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various forms of aquatic life.
